Justification: To confirm the elevated glucose levels and assess if they are consistently high.
To evaluate average blood sugar levels over the past 2-3 months and help diagnose diabetes.
To assess how the body processes glucose and determine if there is impaired glucose tolerance.
To check for glucose in the urine, which can indicate high blood sugar levels.
To evaluate cholesterol levels, as individuals with elevated glucose may also have lipid abnormalities.
To rule out thyroid disorders that can affect metabolism and glucose levels.
